thread.title: Obama: Senate should work through recess on NSA
thread.title_full: Obama: Senate should work through recess on NSA

title: Obama: Senate should work through recess on NSA
text: The Patriot Act explained 02:54 Story highlights Authorization for the NSA's bulk data collection program is set to run out Sunday Lawmakers are set to return from Memorial Day recess hours before the program hours before the deadline Washington (CNN) President Barack Obama on Tuesday urged Congress to reach a deal to reform and extend the Patriot Act provisions set to expire on Monday. "I strongly urge them to work through this recess and identify a way to get this done," Obama said during an Oval Office meeting with NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg. "This needs to get done." The National Security Agency's bulk metadata collection program, which has allowed the NSA to collect and store phone data on millions of Americans, will sunset on Monday unless Congress passes legislation by midnight on Sunday. Obama and his administration have endorsed the USA Freedom Act, the bill to make changes to the Patriot Act that overwhelmingly passed the House of Representatives, but came three votes shy of passage in the Senate this weekend. Obama said Tuesday that bill "strikes an appropriate balance; our intelligence communities are confident that they can work with the authorities that are provided in that act." JUST WATCHED
